question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}4 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}4 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-1 & 0 & 5\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 2 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-1 & 0 & 5\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 2 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the third component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}2 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & -4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}0 & -3 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}5 & 2 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-2 & -2 & -2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}-1 & 0 & 3\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}5 & 4 & 3\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the third component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.

question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-3 & -4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{v} = \begin{bmatrix}-2 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the Hadamard product $\mathbf{u} \odot \mathbf{v}$.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Recall that the Hadamard product calculates the vector of componentwise products.
